p: I have just received in the mail a reprint of the Honorable Charles Thone's resolution entered Wednesday, April 21, 1971, in the Congressional Record. This is indeed a fitting commendation to mark your fiftieth anniversary as Poet Laureate of Nebraska. You have brought honor to all of us and glorified our State.

Not being a stay-up-late person, I had never heard a Dick Cavett Show before watching his interview with you. While it is always a privilege to hear again your readings and reminiscences, my greatest pleasure was watching Cavett's delight of discovery. You were a new sun on his horizon, and was he basking!
Congratulations on all the well-deserved honors.
Give the Youngs my best regards. I'm looking forward to my trip to Lincoln June 7th.
